subjective.chiefComplaint: Initial consultation for testosterone replacement therapy
subjective.historyOfPresentIllness:
Jacob Henderson is a 29-year-old male presenting for evaluation of low testosterone symptoms. Patient reports decreased energy, difficulty recovering from workouts, reduced muscle mass despite consistent training, and mild fatigue. He exercises 4-5 times per week and maintains a healthy diet but has noticed declining performance over the past 6 months.

Patient reports being very active and working out regularly. He states he has had some difficulty maintaining strength gains and notices prolonged recovery time between training sessions. His primary motivation for considering TRT is to restore energy levels, improve recovery, and optimize his training outcomes. Patient is comfortable with self-administering intramuscular injections but will need education on proper technique.
subjective.reviewOfSystems: Reports fatigue, decreased motivation, and prolonged muscle soreness. Denies mood changes, sleep disturbances, or decreased libido.

objective.physicalExam:
Current medications: Multivitamin and creatine 5 grams daily
Allergies: No known allergies
objective.labResults:
Recent laboratory results from March 2025:
• Total Testosterone: 285 ng/dL (low-normal, ref 300-1000)
• Free Testosterone: 6.2 ng/dL (low, ref 9-30)
• TSH: 1.35 (within normal limits)
• Lipid panel: Normal, no concerns
• CBC: All values within normal limits, Hematocrit 42%
• PSA: 0.6 ng/mL (normal)
• CMP: All values within normal limits
• LH: 4.2 mIU/mL (normal)
• Estradiol: 22 pg/mL (normal)

assessment.clinicalImpression: 29-year-old male with symptoms consistent with low testosterone. Laboratory results confirm low-normal total testosterone with low free testosterone. Patient maintains an active lifestyle with regular exercise 4-5 times weekly, follows a balanced diet focused on whole foods, rarely consumes alcohol, and does not use tobacco or nicotine products. Given symptomatic presentation and confirmatory labs, patient is an appropriate candidate for testosterone replacement therapy.

plan.instructions: Inject 0.5mL (100mg) intramuscularly once weekly. Rotate injection sites between thighs and deltoids. Dispense 10mL vial with 5 refills. Prescription sent on 11/17/2025 at 9:45 AM Eastern Standard Time. Patient will be provided education on intramuscular injection technique. Recheck labs in 6 weeks to assess levels and adjust dose as needed.
plan.followUp: Follow-up in 6 weeks with repeat testosterone and CBC

subjective.historyOfPresentIllness: Patient returns for weight management consultation. Currently on testosterone replacement therapy with good response - reports improved energy and recovery. Interested in adding GLP-1 medication to support body composition goals. Current weight 160 lbs, goal is to reduce body fat percentage while maintaining muscle mass.
subjective.reviewOfSystems: No concerns. TRT well tolerated with improved energy levels. No injection site reactions.

objective.physicalExam: Healthy appearing male. No concerning findings.

assessment.clinicalImpression: Active 29-year-old male seeking to optimize body composition. Currently responding well to TRT. Good candidate for low-dose GLP-1 therapy for fat loss while maintaining muscle mass from resistance training.

plan.instructions: Start Semaglutide at 0.25mg weekly. Maintain high protein intake (1g/lb body weight) to preserve muscle. Continue resistance training. Monitor for GI side effects in first 2 weeks.
plan.followUp: Follow-up in 4 weeks for dose assessment

subjective.chiefComplaint: Hair thinning at crown and temples
subjective.historyOfPresentIllness: Patient reports gradual hair loss over past 2 years. Family history of pattern baldness. No recent stressors or medication changes.
subjective.reviewOfSystems: Denies scalp itching, pain, or skin changes

objective.physicalExam: Photos reviewed - Norwood Stage II-III pattern baldness. No scarring or inflammation noted.

assessment.clinicalImpression: Classic presentation of androgenetic alopecia in 36yo female. Good candidate for Finasteride therapy.

plan.instructions: Continue for minimum 6 months to assess efficacy. Take at same time daily.
plan.followUp: Follow-up in 3 months to assess progress

subjective.historyOfPresentIllness: Patient returns for follow-up. Reports decreased shedding and early signs of regrowth at temples. No side effects from Finasteride. Adherent to daily regimen.
subjective.reviewOfSystems: No concerns. Denies any new symptoms.

objective.physicalExam: Photos compared to baseline - visible improvement in hair density at temples and crown. Hairline appears more defined.

assessment.clinicalImpression: Excellent response to Finasteride at 3 months. Patient motivated to continue.

plan.instructions: Continue current regimen. Consider adding Minoxidil 5% if patient desires accelerated results.

subjective.historyOfPresentIllness: Patient continues on Finasteride with good results. Interested in adding Minoxidil to further enhance results. No side effects reported.

objective.physicalExam: Continued improvement from 3-month visit. Crown density significantly improved. Temple regrowth maintained.

assessment.clinicalImpression: Sustained response to oral therapy. Good candidate for combination therapy.

medications: Add Minoxidil 5% solution - apply to scalp BID
plan.instructions: Apply Minoxidil to dry scalp morning and evening. Allow to dry before styling. May experience temporary shedding in first 2-4 weeks.
plan.followUp: Follow-up in 3 months to assess combination therapy
